metadata.synopsis: Avatar asks Astarion about Cazador, his master. Different replies depending on whether we know that Astarion is a vampire spawn or not.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: I hope you're not here to ask about Cazador.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: You said he kept you as a slave. Don't you think we should talk about that?

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: No, I don't. The past is dead, so why exhume it when we have a nice, bright future ahead of us?

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: And curious you'll remain. The past is dead, I'm not about to exhume it when there's a nice, bright future ahead of me.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: Assuming we don't turn into mind flayers, of course. That might put a bit of a damper on things.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: The point is, I'm looking forward. Focusing on what's important for our future.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: Exactly! So, was there anything else?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: The past is important. I need to know what made you who you are.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: Spite made me who I am. Now let sleeping dogs lie, lest you get bitten.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: How can I trust you if you keep secrets from me?

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: Oh please, you think I'm the only one with secrets? At least you know there's something I'm not telling you.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Trust me to do what's best for me - our fates are linked. I need you and you need me. It's that simple.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: And right now what's best for me is some quiet. Until later.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: No, I wanted to ask about something else.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: I suppose you want to hear about Cazador.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You said he was your master?

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: My old master. Before the mind flayers took me from him. Before this strange, twisted freedom.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You don't have to tell me anything you don't want to.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: I don't want to say a damned thing, but that won't do anyone any good.

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: Cazador Szarr is a vampire lord in Baldur's Gate. The patriarch of his coven and a monster obsessed with power.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: Not political power or military power - I mean power over people. The power to control them completely.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: He turned me nearly two hundred years ago. I became his spawn and he became my tormentor.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: How were you turned? Did he attack you?

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Not him, no. A gang of thugs attacked me, angry about a ruling that I'd handed down as magistrate.

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: They beat me to death's door when Cazador appeared. He chased them off and offered to save me. To give me eternal life.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: Given that my choices were 'eternal life' or 'bleed to death on the street', I took him up on the offer.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: It was only afterwards I realised just how long 'eternity' could be.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: You've been a slave ever since?

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: A vampire's spawn is less than a slave. They're a puppet.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: We have no choice but to obey our masters' commands. They speak and our bodies react - it's all part of the deal.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: Sometimes he'd order us to submit to torture. Sometimes he'd have us torture ourselves. Whatever his weathervane mood settled on.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Not a good master, I take it?

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: He had me go out into Baldur's Gate to fetch him the most beautiful souls I could find.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: It was a fun little ritual of his - I'd bring them back and he'd ask if I wanted to dine with him. And if I said yes, he'd serve me a dead, putrid rat.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: Of course if I said no, he'd have me flayed. Hard to say which was worse.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: That sounds terrible. I'm so sorry.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: Thank you, but this isn't about sympathy. It's about knowing what we might be up against.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: The mind flayers aren't the only monsters out there. They're not even the only ones hunting us.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: All I'm asking is that you keep your eyes open. And watch out for anything lurking in the shadows.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I'll watch your back, don't worry.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: What more could I ask? Now, is that all?

68.speaker: Player
68.text: You keep me safe and I'll do the same.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Oh no, my friend. If vampires come looking for you, you're on your own.

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: If you think they'll take me and spare you, you haven't been listening.
62.context: NodeContext: player says they won't help you if Cazador comes calling.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: But at least we know where we all stand.

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: The mind flayers aren't the only monsters out there. And they might not be the only ones hunting us.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You're free now. Enjoy that freedom.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: I will, but I won't take it for granted.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Quite the sob story, but what's your point?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Enough - I need to talk to you about something else.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Oh? And what might that be?

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: Oh? Then what do you want?

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: Now that you know what I am, I should tell you that Cazador was more than just a slaver.
